title: Admin / Human Resource Officer Job at Fiphs Infrastructure Limited
content:
Fiphs Infrastructure Limited is an Engineering, Procurement and Construction Company with extensive local knowledge, engineering and construction expertise. We deliver innovative and creative solutions that provide our stakeholders with the highest possible level of expertise, exceeding their expectation using cutting edge technology to provide services covering planning, design, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role / Objectives
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Construction Company seeks to recruit an Admin/Human Resource officer, who will be responsible for the general administrative activities of the organization as well as providing HR support.


Position Overview / Responsibilities


	Operate and manage multi-line telephone and route incoming calls.
	Draft internal memorandum, letters and other documents as required
	Maintain records: organize and store paperwork, documents and computer-based information.
	Oversee the ordering of stationery and maintain office supplies and replenish inventory.
	Organize and attend meetings, take minutes and keep notes.
	Ensure filing systems are maintained and up to date and also ensure protection of files and records.
	Assist in recruitment process
	Assist in preparation of Admin & HR budget.
	Assist in administering HMO for staff
	Assist in implementation and administration of company’s HR policy /standard.
	Assist in the management of the office facility to ensure good working condition for staff.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Law, or equivalent in Human Resources Management, Administration
	Minimum of 3 years of post NYSC in-depth experience of Human resource practices & Labor laws
	A professional approach which generates credibility and confidence in others.
	A professional approach which generates credibility and confidence in others.
	Ability to cope with pressure and work to tight deadlines.
	Great team player.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, attached with a Cover Letter, passport photograph, Degree Certificate, NYSC Certificate and any other professional/relevant certificates in one (1) email to: recruitment@fiphs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidates who do not comply with the above directives will be disqualified.

title: Senior Legal Counsel & Compliance Officer Job at HR Hive

title: Growth and Marketing Strategist (Team Lead) Job at HR Hive
content:
TheHRHive - Our client, a Microfinance Bank, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Growth and Marketing Strategist (Team Lead)
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Growth and Marketing Strategist will lead the Growth and Marketing department, driving customer acquisition, engagement, and retention strategies across all channels.
	The ideal candidate will be data-driven, creatively inclined, and results-oriented, with a strong understanding of digital and traditional marketing in the financial services sector.
	This role requires strategic oversight, team leadership, and hands-on execution of high-impact growth initiatives to expand the bank’s customer base and market share.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and own the bank’s comprehensive growth and marketing strategy, aligned with overall business goals.
	Lead the development of integrated marketing campaigns to support product launches, partnerships, and brand visibility.
	Identify market opportunities and customer segments, designing targeted campaigns to capture value.
	Design and implement scalable growth strategies across online and offline channels (SEO, paid ads, referrals, activations, partnerships).
	Oversee user funnel optimization from awareness to conversion and retention.
	Lead customer acquisition through B2C and B2B strategies, ensuring cost-effective customer growth.
	Position and strengthen the Aella brand across all customer touchpoints.
	Craft compelling messaging and oversee content strategy for digital and offline campaigns.
	Manage PR, media buying, and agency relationships to ensure consistent and high-quality external communication.
	Lead and mentor a multidisciplinary marketing team.
	Set clear KPIs and performance goals for the department.
	Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Data, and Customer Success to drive aligned growth initiatives.
	Analyze campaign performance and customer data to refine marketing strategy.
	Develop dashboards and reporting tools to track conversion rates, and other growth metrics.
	A/B test key campaigns and customer journeys to improve results continuously.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field. MBA is a plus.
	5 – 7 years of progressive experience in growth, digital marketing, or brand strategy, preferably in financial services, fintech, or tech.
	Proven success in scaling marketing initiatives and achieving growth targets.
	Experience leading a team and managing agency/vendor relationships.
	Strong understanding of marketing tech tools (e.g., Google Ads, Meta Ads, CRM systems, analytics platforms).


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strategic and analytical mindset with strong business acumen.
	Excellent communication, storytelling, and brand positioning skills.
	Data-driven decision-making and performance marketing expertise.
	Strong leadership and team development capabilities.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.


Salary
N500,000 - N700,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: thehrhive@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
